text_content:
--- Page 1 ---
COMPREHENSIVE MEDICAL RECORD TEST DOCUMENT
Complete 12/12 Resource Type Coverage Test
Patient: John Test Doe
DOB: 01/15/1965
MRN: TEST-12345
===============================================
ENCOUNTER INFORMATION
===============================================
Patient seen in EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT on 10/28/2024 at 14:30
Chief Complaint: Chest pain and shortness of breath
Attending Physician: Dr. Sarah Johnson, Cardiology
Consulting Physician: Dr. Michael Chen, Pulmonology
Location: Springfield Memorial Hospital Emergency Department
Status: Patient evaluated and admitted
Discharge Date: 10/30/2024
===============================================
VITAL SIGNS (10/28/2024 14:35)
===============================================
Blood Pressure: 145/92 mm Hg
Heart Rate: 98 bpm
Temperature: 98.6 F
Respiratory Rate: 22 breaths/min
Oxygen Saturation: 94% on room air
Weight: 185 lbs
Height: 70 inches
===============================================
ALLERGIES
===============================================
- Penicillin - Severe anaphylaxis (confirmed 2010)
- Shellfish - Hives and swelling (confirmed 2015)
- Latex - Contact dermatitis (mild, 2018)
===============================================
CURRENT MEDICATIONS
===============================================
1. Lisinopril 10mg PO once daily - Started 01/2020
2. Metformin 500mg PO twice daily with meals - Started 03/2018
3. Atorvastatin 20mg PO once daily at bedtime - Started 06/2019
4. Aspirin 81mg PO once daily - Started 01/2020

--- Page 2 ---
===============================================
ACTIVE MEDICAL CONDITIONS
===============================================
- Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (diagnosed 2018) - Active, well-controlled
- Hypertension (diagnosed 2020) - Active, on treatment
- Hyperlipidemia (diagnosed 2019) - Active, stable
- Coronary Artery Disease (diagnosed 10/2024) - Active, under evaluation
===============================================
DIAGNOSTIC REPORTS - LAB RESULTS (10/28/2024)
===============================================
TROPONIN: 0.8 ng/m L (ref: <0.04) - ELEVATED
Report Date: 10/28/2024 15:00
Status: FINAL
Interpretation: Elevated troponin consistent with myocardial injury
Recommendation: Serial troponins, cardiology consult, ECG monitoring
COMPLETE BLOOD COUNT:
- WBC: 8.5 K/u L (ref: 4.0-11.0) - Normal
- Hemoglobin: 14.2 g/d L (ref: 13.5-17.5) - Normal
- Platelets: 245 K/u L (ref: 150-400) - Normal
Report Date: 10/28/2024 15:10
Status: Final
BASIC METABOLIC PANEL:
- Glucose: 145 mg/d L (ref: 70-100) - Elevated
- Creatinine: 1.1 mg/d L (ref: 0.7-1.3) - Normal
- Sodium: 139 m Eq/L (ref: 136-145) - Normal
- Potassium: 4.2 m Eq/L (ref: 3.5-5.0) - Normal
Report Date: 10/28/2024 15:15
Hb A1c: 7.2% (ref: <5.7%) - Diabetic range
Report Date: 10/25/2024
Status: Final
Conclusion: Diabetes suboptimally controlled
===============================================
DIAGNOSTIC REPORTS - IMAGING (10/28/2024)
===============================================
CHEST X-RAY (2 views)
Performed: 10/28/2024 14:45
Report Date: 10/28/2024 16:00
Radiologist: Dr. Patricia Lee

--- Page 3 ---
Findings: Mild cardiomegaly. No acute infiltrates, effusions, or pneumothorax. Lung fields clear
bilaterally. Impression: Cardiomegaly, no acute pulmonary process
Status: Final
ECHOCARDIOGRAM
Performed: 10/28/2024 18:30
Report Date: 10/29/2024 09:00
Cardiologist: Dr. Robert Williams
Findings: LV ejection fraction 45%, mild LV hypertrophy, trace mitral regurgitation
Impression: Reduced ejection fraction consistent with systolic dysfunction
Recommendations: Start beta blocker, ACE inhibitor optimization, cardiology follow-up
Status: Final
===============================================
PROCEDURES PERFORMED
===============================================
1. EKG 12-lead (10/28/2024 14:40) - Performed by Tech Martinez
Findings: ST elevation in leads II, III, a VF
2. IV catheter placement (10/28/2024 14:50) - Performed by Nurse Williams
Location: Left antecubital fossa, 18 gauge
3. Blood draw for cardiac enzymes (10/28/2024 14:55) - Performed by Lab Tech Johnson
4. Cardiac catheterization (scheduled for 10/29/2024) - Dr. Sarah Johnson
===============================================
SERVICE REQUESTS / ORDERS
===============================================
1. STAT Cardiology Consult - Ordered by Dr. Anderson 10/28/2024 14:55
Reason: Elevated troponin, chest pain, ECG changes
Priority: STAT
2. Serial Troponins q6h x 3 - Ordered 10/28/2024 15:00
Priority: Routine
3. Cardiac Catheterization - Ordered by Dr. Johnson 10/28/2024 20:00
Indication: Rule out acute MI, evaluate for intervention
Priority: Urgent
Scheduled: 10/29/2024 08:00
4. Echocardiogram - Ordered 10/28/2024 16:30
Completed: 10/28/2024 18:30

--- Page 4 ---
5. Referral to Cardiac Rehabilitation - Ordered 10/29/2024
Provider: Springfield Cardiac Rehab Center
Priority: Routine
===============================================
CARE PLAN - ACUTE CARDIAC CARE
===============================================
Plan Description: Acute coronary syndrome management with optimization of cardiac risk
factors
Goals:
- Stabilize cardiac condition and prevent further myocardial damage
- Achieve optimal blood pressure control (target <130/80)
- Improve diabetes control (target Hb A1c <7.0%)
- Initiate cardiac rehabilitation program
- Smoking cessation (patient currently smokes 1 PPD)
Planned Activities:
- Serial cardiac enzymes and ECG monitoring
- Cardiac catheterization for definitive diagnosis
- Medication optimization (beta blocker, ACE inhibitor, statin)
- Daily blood glucose monitoring
- Low sodium diet (2g/day)
- Cardiac rehabilitation referral
- Smoking cessation counseling
- Follow-up with cardiology in 1 week
Plan Timeline: 10/28/2024 - 04/28/2025 (6 months)
Status: Active
Intent: Treatment plan
===============================================
HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS
===============================================
1. Dr. Emily Anderson, MD - Emergency Medicine
Role: Attending Physician (Emergency Department)
Contact: 217/555/1100
2. Dr. Sarah Johnson, MD, FACC - Cardiology
Role: Consulting Cardiologist
Specialty: Interventional Cardiology
Contact: 217/555/1200

--- Page 5 ---
3. Dr. Michael Chen, MD - Pulmonology
Role: Consulting Pulmonologist
Contact: 217/555/1300
4. Dr. Robert Williams, MD - Cardiology
Role: Echocardiography specialist
Specialty: Cardiac Imaging
===============================================
ORGANIZATIONS / FACILITIES
===============================================
1. Springfield Memorial Hospital
Type: Hospital
Address: 123 Medical Center Drive
City: Springfield, State: IL, ZIP: 62701
Phone: 217/555/1000
NPI: 1234567890
2. Springfield Cardiac Rehab Center
Type: Outpatient Rehabilitation Facility
Address: 456 Wellness Way
City: Springfield, State: IL, ZIP: 62702
Phone: 217/555/2000
3. Regional Laboratory Services
Type: Clinical Laboratory
Address: 789 Lab Lane
City: Springfield, State: IL, ZIP: 62703
Phone: 217/555/3000
NPI: 9876543210
===============================================
ASSESSMENT & PLAN SUMMARY
===============================================
IMPRESSION: 58-year-old male with chest pain, elevated troponin, and ECG changes
concerning for acute coronary syndrome. Patient has multiple cardiac risk factors including
diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and smoking. PLAN:
1. Admit to cardiac care unit
2. Serial cardiac enzymes and continuous ECG monitoring
3. Cardiac catheterization in AM
4. Optimize medical management
5. Diabetes and hypertension management

--- Page 6 ---
6. Cardiac rehabilitation referral
7. Smoking cessation program
8. Follow-up care plan as outlined above
Documented by: Dr. Emily Anderson, MD
Date: 10/28/2024 21:00
